div.p: Greetings and Peace. For the book which you sent to me and for the one you gave a little earlier, I am grateful to you, and I would already be repaying this gratitude if my little commentary on the affairs of Zürich had been completed; but I am still working on it whenever I have time, and I do not see how it can be completed so soon. However, I will fulfill my promise in due time and ensure that it (whatever its quality may be) is delivered to you. You will do me a favor if you write to us from time to time, and a great favor if you share any news you have that is either pleasant to know or necessary for us to learn. Farewell.
In Basel, on the third day before the Kalends of April 1548 in the French manner, in your manner 1549. Yours sincerely, Christophorus Richer.
To the distinguished and venerable man, Heinrich Bullinger, pastor of Zürich, his dear friend from the heart. In Zürich.
